alert.note: Alert for Cleveland; McClain; Oklahoma (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 8:26PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Oklahoma, northern Cleveland and northwestern McClain Counties through 900 PM CDT... At 825 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Oklahoma City to near Valley Brook to near Cole. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Oklahoma City, Norman, Moore, Midwest City, Del City, Newcastle, Bethany, Choctaw, Warr Acres, The Village, Noble, Slaughterville, Spencer, Nichols Hills, Jones, Nicoma Park, Goldsby, Valley Brook, Cole, and Stanley Draper Lake. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 100 and 135. Interstate 40 between mile markers 144 and 170. Interstate 44 between mile markers 114 and 130. Interstate 240 between mile markers 1 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
